item.title: April-lyn add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: April-lyn add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "The moral of Snow White is never eat apples." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: April-lyn add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: April-lyn add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: April-lyn add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "E.L. Doctorow said once said that 'Writing a novel is like driving a car at night. You can see only as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.' You don't have to see where you're going, you don't have to see your destination or everything you will pass along the way. You just have to see two or three feet ahead of you. This is right up there with the best advice on writing, or life, I have ever heard." -- Anne Lamott
